metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6778 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The CJBig2_SymbolDict class in fxcodec/jbig2/JBig2_SymbolDict.cpp in PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before 47.0.2526.73, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a PDF document containing crafted data with JBIG2 compression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
